page.title: 04POND LIFE, LIDO, WINGERWORTH
page.content: {The Lido}is a man made pond measuring about .People pay a year to fish there. They can catch {perch, pike, rudd, tench, roach, chub, {bullhead dace and minnows. }There are also a large number of{frogs}and{toads in the lido. Toads are now quite rare so at spawning time there is a road sign on Nethermoor Road warning drivers of 'Toads crossing'. The Lido is also home for water birds such as {swans, coots, grebes, moorhens and {mallards.} The Lido is important to the locals, not only is it a habitat for wildlife, but it is surrounded by woods, grassland and a play area for children containing swings and slides. It is a popular area for people to walk their dogs and in the autumn the locals pick {blackberries}and gather{conkers. }
